title: Soooooo... the Ionian invasion is still going on?
body:
How long has Noxus been at war with them? unless this is in the past... but if not, you'd think that the Demacia, Piltover, and maybe even the Yordles would be intervening in this. I am so confused...
{{sticker:zombie-brand-mindblown}}

replies.body: Demacia wouldn't be touching that with a barge pole. It's just not on their front door. Piltover has reasons to stay neutral.
So Ionia has no alliance with Demacia I assume?
You assume correctly.
I see.  Forgive me for asking, but has Demacia made attempts in the past or is Ionia some mystical land that was only discovered recently before Noxus invaded it?

In the original pre-Great Retcon lore, Demacia was notorious for not intervening in anything unless it directly involved them. They stayed the hell out of Ionia and out of the Freljord during the Barbarian Pacification campaign. While they're opposed to Noxus, they don't exactly jump at the chance to defend other nations. 

I'm assuming that, in the new lore, Ionia is just as well-known as Piltover or Zaun. Demacia just isn't interested in expending manpower to defend them.
Ionia is very hard to miss. And yeah, Demacia takes care of Demacia.

People from Shurima are just nomads now, suppose they wander for work.

BIG EDIT: This is a comment that will contain some spoilers of the new champion's lore.



In the story of the new champion, the Shuriman Empire is still known to be buried in sand, and most of the Shurimans live in tribes, and are nomads.

In Sivir's case, she is a known mercenary, that would do almost everything for some good gold. She had numerous missions for Noxus, and some people still don't get why she did not go in the Ionia-Noxus War.

The new champion instead volunteered to help them, but immediately left, not really enjoying her decision. When she and Yasuo went to a tavern, they two merchants who told them about the "Bird God", and how he does this and that. That is the moment when it is known that Azir has awakened. 

Until she went to Ionia, she didn't know anything about Azir, and even now when she knows that the "Bird God" is back, she fears that this God will enslave her people instead of thinking about Shuriman Empire's restoration. Every single Shuriman believed that their old empire was lost forever until they met Azir. 

Her story is not over, and Shurima still isn't reborn.

Yes.  And Americans like to think of themselves as the hero (Watch "Hetalia".  The anime has characters who personifies each individual country.)

And the thing is, this is also politics.  Demacia can't interfere in every single thing Noxus does or every single thing bad going on around them.

For Demacia to be willing to randomly jump in and say "Eff you" to Noxus with their invasion of Ionia, Demacia needs to be able to get something out of it.  And what they get needs to be more than just "Ha. Nice try Evil."  Demacia getting involved means that they're either trying to achieve 1 of 3 things

1.) Cripple Noxus (which is the most obvious, but that only gets them so much if nothing else comes of it)

2.) Acquire Land and Resources  (they are trying to stop Noxus from taking Ionian land and resources, so Demacia may have rights to Ionian land and resources.

3.) Self honor.  (now, while this may seem like the point you tried to make earlier, Demacia has no dealings with Ionia nor cause to fight for them.  Especially if Demacia is trying to care chiefly for themselves and build upon their own power and might.  But if, say, Zaun, who is a close ally of Noxus during the invasion did something to Demacia in the meanwhile, not ONLY will Demacia protect Ionia from Noxus, but they will also make sure that Zaun burns.)


When it comes to government dealings and politics, jumping headlong into every single fight a non-ally commits to or jumping at the chance to protect every single country that has no need of your protection (or rather would cause you to lose resources and commit to something that should be left alone) does not bode well for the future.

america was already supplying some tanks and resources to other countries though before they entered the war themselves.

It's lore with new characters being introduced with their own separate yet similar lore. It is very possible that the lore's timeline is not parallel with the League of Legends (the actual lore League of Legends) timeline - it could have taken place a long time ago. Just don't question it - I treat the Runeterra lore as a completely different timeline than in the League of Legends (game) lore because there's not much you can do to make the two timelines parallel.
To be completely honest, I think that the League of Legends is the "Hunger Games" of Runeterra.

Hmm. Kind of off topic, but with the new little bit of lore with Yasuo, I got to thinking, who killed the elder? Riven, probably not. Swain and his birb couldn't really do it. LB, again, isn't a wind person. I doubt Talon and Katarina where involved in this thin... Wait. Talon and Katarina. Katarina Du Couteau. We know that Katarina's father, General Du Couteau, disappeared. We don't know when. We don't know why. We don't know how. So, what if he went to Ionia and killed the elder. We don't know what Du Couteau can do, other than he is an amazing swordsman and handed Talon his ass. Maybe he knows a wind technique, and so when he was away from Noxus, he assassinated the elder. He has a motive, and he certainly has the skill.
